question: {name1} and {name2} went to a construction supply store. {name2} is a member, but {name1} is not. {name1} has {cur}{initial_1} and wants to buy {n1} {item1}s from a bin at the store. She also needs {n2} {item2}s, each costing {cur}{p2}. Each {item1} costs {cur}{p1}. Additionally, {name1} picks up {n3} gallons of paint. {name2} starts with {cur}{initial_2} and wants {n33} gallons of paint, each priced at {cur}{p3}, and {n44} carpenter pencils, each costing {cur}{p4}. The store offers a 10% discount on paint for members. How much more money does {name1} have left than {name2} after they leave the store?
private_constraints: initial_1 > n1 * p1 + n2 * p2 + n3 * p3
initial_1 - (n1 * p1 + n2 * p2 + n3 * p3) > initial_2 - (n33 * p3 * 0.9 + n44 * p4)
is_int(initial_1 - (n1 * p1 + n2 * p2 + n3 * p3))
